title: Zac skins??
body:
Dear Riot, 
  Please don't think me rude, and I doubt you'll even read this but I figured I'd try since my new year resolution is to stay positive. May I ask if you are gonna make a  new Zac skin? I feel like he is left out. he's been out for awhile and has one skin. He can have so many opportunities if you give him a shot. Bubble gum Zac, Super Gooper Zac, H2 Zac aka water Zac, Jello dessert Zac. but he needs some love{{champion:154}}

replies.body:
**disclaimer* - Zac skins are a hot topic and we are not able to answer any questions about -when- a skin is coming out or is in the works (or any other skins). I'm here to perhaps shed a little light and let you guys know Zac is not forgotten!*

Definitely don't think you're being rude! What I can tell you is that Zac's champ and stretchy tech is very difficult to work with, and that alone increases work time on him a lot. So using a popular community skin suggestion for him, Gentleman Zac - his clothes especially around his arms would have some crazy weighting and stretching issues. And it would also be really weird to see cloth stretching and turning into globs of goo haha I'd love to hear any suggestions on workarounds you may have to mitigate this!

I know "easy" recolored skins have been suggested for Mr. Blob, but then it would seem unfair if say we released a 750RP Bubblegum Zac and have him wait a while for another skin instead of taking the time to make sure we make a super awesome blow-your-mind quality skin for him.

Considering Zac's unique gooey appearance, how about a special *"several simple skins for the price of one happy fun time Zac skin"*-bundle?


And by simple, I mean literal recolor. For instance, making a pink Zac rather than trying to do anything to make him look bubble-gummy.


I mean, his base texture and appearance might look cool in a variety of different colours with little changes, like "White Zac", "Black Zac", etc.


I don't know your client works, but if it's anything remotely close to Warcraft 3's editor, changing colour should be rather simple. And it's simplicity may allow you to create a bundle of cheap Zac skins sold at the price of one.
--------------------
Do note I'm not suggesting you do this for all champions, or anyone other than Zac. I mean do this bundle for Zac and literally just Zac as his nature would make a simple recolor look really cool. Much cooler than say...*"Garen in Black Armour"* that's for sure.

Actually, going a bit further with this, a lava lamp zac skin would be really epic without being too difficult to make - zac with lava lamp-ish texture overlay, and he constantly slowly shifts from one color to another. Or alternatively, paint bucket style zac where he switches to a different color whenever he picks up one of his blobs, and his blobs drop in the colors they'd change him to and are paint bucket styled

It shouldn't, actually. To make Zac's arms stretch, I assume you are using a deformation gradient that defines how much each vertex follows the movement of the skeleton during the animations.

If pure red means following the shoulder end of the arm "bones" exactly, and pure blue means following the wrist end of the arm "bones" exactly, you just pick a particular shade of purple close to the floatie and make the entire floatie have that shade in the deformation gradient. Like this:

Basically, what I'm saying is that it's *even easier* to make the floaties work properly than it is to make them stretch strangely, because all you need to do is "forget" to add the gradients that would make the floaties not move as a solid mass.

Sorry I'm alittle late to this party.  Would a Mecha or Battlecast skin be within the realm of possible options?  Mechanical parts can stretch out using pistons or expanding metal plates and his globlets could be changed to power cores, scrap metal or nuts and bolts piles.

It's definitely possible, but a Mecha/Battlecast skin would mean we would basically have to re-do every animation he has (among other things) so that the metal pieces don't look stretchy while he undulates around > u < (*and* add extra animations for his little pistons and stuff!) If you check out videos of Zac, the mass of his goo sort of shifts itself all over his body, and that might look strange translated to metal :x

EDIT: Not saying it can't be done, but a skin like this would definitely run into a lot of issues and would probably be a legendary skin :)

Actually, I've had this idea in my head for a while for a new kind of robot Zac. He could be composed of a kind of glowing hextech core, surrounded by a large number of metal shards and plates held in place around him by a magnetic force to form his body. This would give him a thematic way to keep his passive and his model-scaling-with-max-health mechanics without stretching (heh) things too much, as he could theoretically incorporate any random pieces of metal he finds into his body to increase his size.

EDIT: I think I might post this idea as its own thread sometime soon, with more detail.

Any mechanical skin for Zac would have to be Legendary tier at least, considering how much model work would have to go into that. For me personally, that's a huge plus (I would absolutely buy any Legendary or Ultimate skin for Zac), but it also means that it would be quite some time before any such skin could be released.
